Compatible with iOS 8, 9 and 10.

Requiresfrom AppStore. Tested on Spotify version 8.4.24.

Flipswitches and more for Spotify.

With this package you will be able to:
* Control Spotify Connect devices
* Add current track to playlist
* Add current track to collection
* Control Offline Mode
* Control Incognito Mode
* Control Shuffle
* Control Repeat
* Automatically pause Spotify on 0% volume (optional)

Feel free to use the donate button down below if you're enjoying this tweak as it has taken a lot of time to develop.

Source code available on.

Could be configured using Activator. Use Polus for Flipswitches in Control Center.

Configure options in Settings

• Fixed crashes on iPad • Fixed sandbox issues on iOS 9 • Fixed settings not appearing • Overall improvements • Now sorts Connect devices per request Fixed crash on Spotify 8.4.24 and above. Support for Spotify version 8.4.11 (and versions below that). Fixed issue in Spotify where playlists wouldn't get fetched

Fixed check of duplicate tracks

Updates displayed playlists on rename or removal
* Now waits for passcode when trying to launch Spotify.
* Icons will now show up in CC. Note: FlipControlCenter is showing them as reverted. I recommend using Polus instead. This is an issue in FCC.
* Resolved bug with empty playlists list.
* Added flipswitch for Incognito Mode.
* Added check for duplicates in Add to Playlist.
* Added option to pause music on 0% volume.
* Added option to specify playlist name (won’t show playlist choices). Note: case sensitive!
* Added settings pane with these options.
* Now updating list of Spotify Connect devices if you're going offline.
* Added "Add to Collection" listener
* Added “Add To Playlist”. Uses "Recently Placed" playlists.
* Had forgot to force Spotify to last known offline mode state on app launch. Now added.
* Resolved bug with shuffle.
* Cleaned up code a lot.


* Added Connectify (Activator listener for Spotify Connect).
* Added Flipswitch for repeat.
* Now automatically initializes Spotify to previously assigned settings.
